mods.abstract: $75 REWARD. Run away from my plantation, 6 miles from the Town of Natchitoches on the 29th, of October three negro men, -one named Louis, aged about 24 years, dark complexiotn and about 6 feet high- when asked question he stutters- one named Bill dark complextion, aged 22 years and about 5 feet high-the other named Punch of bright complextion-age, 22 years and about 5 feet high- he is a very smart fellow-talks english and french fluently-the above reward will be paid for their deliverance to me or lodging them in jail or $25, for the deliverance or lodging of any one of them in jail. R. MCTIER Please publish for one month in the Nat. Union, Shreveport News, Monroe Register and Alexandria Democrat and let them send bill to your office.
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
